intro: Bulbostylis sphaerolepis, commonly known as the globe sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of flowers. Its bulbous base allows it to store water and nutrients, aiding survival in fluctuating moisture conditions. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in swampy or marshy areas.
